alert.note: Alert for Holmes; Wayne (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 8:57PM EST until February 20 at 11:30PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Ohio... Killbuck Creek Near Killbuck affecting Holmes and Wayne Counties. For the Killbuck Creek...including Killbuck...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE SUNDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Killbuck Creek Near Killbuck. * WHEN...Until late Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Private property on Water Street in the Village of Killbuck flooded. Several county and local roads impassable including State Route 60 south and County Road 621. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM EST Thursday the stage was 15.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:00 PM EST Thursday was 15.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 17.3 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday afternoon to 14.5 feet and begin rising again early Monday afternoon. It will rise to 14.6 feet early Tuesday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.4 feet on 06/17/1946. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning by 700 AM EST.
